results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS

results.title: Switch on Bigga
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Electricity Commission of New South Wales (N.S.W.), Stanley Hawes, Lee Robinson and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description: A unique look at the coming of electric power to a small rural district in NSW and the benefits derived from electricity by the farmer and his family. Includes a country style grand switching on ceremony.

results.title: Swiss ski symphony = Schweizer ski-symphonie
results.brief_description: Scenes of skiing of all kinds are carefully edited to synchronise with a symphonic piece played by a full orchestra. Photography by Josef Dahinden and music by Jean Daetwyler. No commentary.

results.title: Swiss on white: winter sports at St. Moritz
results.creator_credit: Central Films and Phillip M. Brown
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine style documentary on winter sports at St Moritz, Switzerland. Items include ice skating, ice hockey, horse racing on ice, trick skating, toboganning, skiing, snow marathon and ski jumping.

results.title: Swiss miss
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hal Roach and John G. Blystone
results.brief_description: Comic operetta in which Laurel and Hardy are mousetrap salesmen in Switzerland. They can’t pay their dinner bill and wind up working in the hotel kitchen to pay expenses. Their stay coincides with the local music festival and they have to contend with a gorilla, two opera singers, a St. Bernard dog and moving a piano up a narrow mountain trail. Based on the original story by Jean Negulesco and Charles Rogers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hal Roach and John G. Blystone

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson [Extracts]
results.brief_description:
While travelling aboard a 19th Century sailing vessel, the sophisticated Robinson family survive a devastating shipwreck and are forced to carve out a daring, primitive new life for themselves on a dangerous, deserted tropical island. Cast includes Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur.
Extracts taken from the Walt Disney 1960 feature film production.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Anderson and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description:
One of Disney’s biggest and most fondly remembered films, chronicles the exploits of the Robinson family after they are shipwrecked on a deserted island. Using teamwork and ingenuity, they skillfully overcome the obstacles of nature but the ultimate challenge lies ahead when a band of pirates threatens their paradise. Stars John Mills, Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur and Janet Munro.
From the novel “Swiss Family Robinson” by Johann Wyss

results.title: Swinging the broom
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Andrew Wiseman and Geoffrey Hall
results.brief_description: An elderly street sweeper, who has grown tired of his supposedly nagging wife, seeks relief from her by meeting the young woman he sees on his cleaning round. Ending up badly beaten, after his intentions have been misunderstood by one of the women, he arrives home to discover a caring wife. They make up and his misguided ways appear over. But are they?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Andrew Wiseman and Geoffrey Hall

results.title: Swingers
results.creator_credit: Independent Pictures, Miramax Films, Victor Simpkins and Doug Liman
results.brief_description: A hip, urban comedy of manners about male friendship, dating and the fantastically labyrinthine rules of how to stay cool in LA. Directed by Doug Liman (Go, The Bourne Identity), this film catapulted into the spotlight actors Jon Favreau (who also wrote the screenplay) and Vince Vaughn. Mike (Favreau), an out of work actor and comedian, is lovesick for his long-term girlfriend who he hasn’t heard from in six months. Buoyed in his misery by friends Trent, Rob and Sue, Mike is taken to a slew of groovy LA bars and parties in the hope that he’ll meet a babe and be jolted out of his despair. Trent (Vaughn) is Mike’s most confident and smooth talking friend, a sartorial charmer who has a way with the ladies and is constantly on the make. Mike struggles with the convoluted courtship rules, whilst battling his extensive self-doubts and self-consciousness. “Swingers” works as a sharp satire of the LA scene where bit actors scrape by on the glory of call-backs for pilots and former glories are regurgitated in the hope of getting lucky in love. With a warm, energetic quality, and a talky, funny script, the film regales the audience with memorable characters and hilarious scenarios.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Independent Pictures, Miramax Films, Victor Simpkins and Doug Liman
